Jason has built his career as an entrepreneur, scientist, technologist, and thought leader with specific expertise in operations, product development, and building & leading interdisciplinary teams. Jason is also a Fellow at the Community Economics Lab, a non-profit think tank focused on the development and implementation of innovative and transformative concepts, approaches and projects focused on economic development and competitiveness. Prior to Evotee and Mouthweight, Jason was Co-Founder & CTO/COO to a startup hedge fund, scientist at Sandia National Laboratories and New Mexico Tech, and a former member of the Advanced Concepts Group - a Dept. of Energy think tank â€“ developing innovative projects to mitigate potential current and future threats to national security.

  • Currently serves on a number of Advisory Boards, including: Set Transmedia, an early-stage next-generation technology & media company.

  • Developed and led new innovative programs for organizations including the National Laboratories, Department of Energy, Department of Defense, and industry including assembling a federal interagency team to focus on mitigating specific terrorist threats.

  • Participated on a Panel for National Research Council, Division of Behavioral and Social Sciences and Education focused on terrorism.

Jason studied physics and biology at New Mexico Institute of Mining and Technology and Astrophysics and Religious Studies the University of New Mexico.
